Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer at 24

Posts.Content: Hi all! I've decided to go for the mastectomy with immediate reconstruction, going for the Latissimus dorsi flap reconstruction because they can use my original breast skin for the op.  I'll have to go back later on to get a nipple put in and tattood but it should look normal(ish) straight away. I feel a lot better now that I have made this decision.  The thing that was upsetting and panicing me the most is the thought of dealing with no breast at all, like you said tweedledee.  So now that I know that's not going to happen I'm coping better. They said if everything goes ok with the healing process, it'd be 4-6 weeks before starting chemo, so it's not much of a delay really. Thank you all again for your support.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with breast cancer at 24

Posts.Content: I have Invasive BC surrounded by DCIS, Grade 2.  The lump is so large that if I did have a lumpectomy the breast that remains would be very small indeed. Posts.Content: Hello. My name is Becci, I am 24 years old and have just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer. I am currently facing the decision of a lumpectomy or a mastectomy with/without reconstruction. There is no history of cancer in my family and because I am quite young, this has come as a very big shock. It would be nice to talk to other people who are facing or have faced this decision. I'm 95% sure I'm going to go with the mastectomy so that I can completely elimate the chance of the surgery missing something.  My choice now though is whether to have reconstruction at the same time (which will delay me having chemo) or to have it after the chemo.  Also there are so many different reconstruction options, I'm just a bit overwhelmed with all the options.
